===Cause and prevalence===
===Cause and prevalence===
â
Virtually no research has been conducted regarding the prevalence of necrophilic attraction among humans. Klaf and Brown<ref name="klaf">Klaf, Franklin S., and William (1958). "Necrophilia: Brief Review and Case Report," ''the Psychoanalytic Quarterly'', 29(143), 645-652. "Inhibited forms of necrophilia and necrophilic fantasies may occur more commonly then is generally realized."</ref> (1958) commented that, although rarely described, necrophilic fantasies may occur more often than is generally supposed.
+
Virtually no research has been conducted regarding the prevalence of necrophilic attraction among humans. Klaf and Brown<ref name="klaf">Klaf, Franklin S., and Brown, William (1958). "Necrophilia: Brief Review and Case Report," ''the Psychoanalytic Quarterly'', 29(143), 645-652. "Inhibited forms of necrophilia and necrophilic fantasies may occur more commonly then is generally realized."</ref> (1958) commented that, although rarely described, necrophilic fantasies may occur more often than is generally supposed.
â

[http://www.burknet.com/robsfantasy/section11a.html "Sexual attraction to corpses: a psychiatric review of necrophilia,"] ''Bulletin of the American Academy of Psychiatry and the Law'', 17, 153-163.</ref> (1989) theorized that either of the following situations could be antecedents to necrophilia (pp. 161):

â
#The necrophile develops poor self-endurance, perhaps due in part to a significant loss;
+
#The necrophile develops poor self-esteem, perhaps due in part to a significant loss;
#:(a) He (usually male) is very fearful of rejection by women and he desires a sexual object who is incapable of rejecting him; and/or
#:(a) He (usually male) is very fearful of rejection by women and he desires a sexual object who is incapable of rejecting him; and/or
#:(b) He is fearful of the dead, and transforms his fear of the deadâby means of reaction formationâinto a desire for the dead.
#:(b) He is fearful of the dead, and transforms his fear of the deadâby means of reaction formationâinto a desire for the dead.
